com.swopteam07.tablr.UI

Class Scrollbar

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Component
      • com.swopteam07.tablr.UI.Scrollbar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Component>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HorizontalScrollbar, VerticalScrollbar

    public abstract class Scrollbar
extends Component

      • getScrollElemLength

        public int getScrollElemLength()
        Returns:
        The length of the scroll element.

      • setScrollElemLength

        protected void setScrollElemLength(int scrollElemLength)
        Set the new length for the scroll element.
        Parameters:
        scrollElemLength - The new length of the scroll element.

      • updateScrollElemLength

        protected abstract void updateScrollElemLength()
        Determine the new length of the scroll element.

      • addScrollOffsetChangedHandler

        public final void addScrollOffsetChangedHandler(ScrollOffsetChangedHandler handler)
        Add a new observer that is to be notified when the scroll element is moved.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler.

      • removeScrollOffsetChangedHandler

        public final void removeScrollOffsetChangedHandler(ScrollOffsetChangedHandler handler)
        Remove an observer. The observer won't be notified anymore when the scroll element is moved.
        Parameters:
        handler - The handler.

      • setEnabled

        protected abstract void setEnabled()
        Enable or disable the scrollbar based on the contentSize.

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the scrollbar is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if the scrollbar is enabled false otherwise.

      • getContentSize

        public final int getContentSize()
        Returns:
        The width of the content this scrollbar can be used to show.

      • isCurrentlyScrolling

        public boolean isCurrentlyScrolling()
        Check if the scroll element is currently being dragged around by the user.
        Returns:
        True if the user is dragging the scroll element around, false otherwise.

      • setCurrentlyScrolling

        public void setCurrentlyScrolling(boolean currentlyScrolling)
        Set the new value for the currently scrolling flag.
        Parameters:
        currentlyScrolling - The new value.
        Postcondition:
        The new value for the currently scrolling flag is equal to the specified value.
            new.isCurrentlyScrolling() == currentlyScrolling

      • setContentSize

        public final void setContentSize(int contentSize)
        Set the new content size.
        Parameters:
        contentSize - The new content size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessError - Thrown when the contentSize is smaller than 0. | contentSize < 0
        Effects:
      • The scrollbar is enabled if necessary.
            setEnabled()
      • The maximum offset is recalculated.
            setMaxOffset()
        • Postcondition:
        The new content size is equal to the specified content size.
            new.getContentSize() == contentSize

      • setStepSize

        public final void setStepSize(int stepSize)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the step size.
        Parameters:
        stepSize - The step size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessError - Thrown when the step size is smaller than or equal to 0. | stepSize <= 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Postcondition:
        The new step size is equal to the given step size, if the step size is larger than 0.
            if stepSize < 0
               new.getStepSize() == stepSize

      • getStepSize

        public final int getStepSize()
        Get the step size of this scroll bar.
        Returns:
        The step size.

                                                 int y)
        Change the scroll elements position based on a mouse drag event.
        Parameters:

        y - The y coordinate to which the scroll element was dragged.

      • setNewScrollPositionClicked

                                                    int y)
        Change the scroll elements position based on a mouse click event somewhere in the scrollbar.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate where the user clicked.
        y - The y coordinate where the user clicked.

      • isBeforeScrollElement

        protected abstract boolean isBeforeScrollElement(int x,
                                                 int y)
        Check if a given (x,y) coordinate is located before the scroll element.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for which to check.
        y - The y coordinate for which to check.
        Returns:
        True if the coordinate is before the scroll element, false otherwise.

      • getScrollPositionClosestTo

        protected abstract int getScrollPositionClosestTo(int x,
                                                  int y)
        Given a coordinate that falls within the scrollbar, get the scrollPosition closest to this coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for which to get the scroll position.
        y - The y coordinate for which to get the scroll position.
        Returns:
        The scroll position closest to the given coordinate.

      • handleClickEvent

        public void handleClickEvent(int id,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int clickCount)
        React to a user clicking on the scrollbar, if the scrollbar is not enabled do nothing.
        Overrides:
        handleClickEvent in class Component
        Parameters:
        id - The type of mouse event.
        x - The x coordinate of the mouse click.
        y - The y coordinate of the mouse click.
        clickCount - The number of times that was clicked.
        Effects:
      • The handleClickEvent method of the Component class is called.
            super.handleClickEvent(id, x, y, clickCount)
      • If the user clicked in the scroll element the setNewScrollPositionDragged function is called.
            if (isInScrollElement(x,y))
               setNewScrollPositionDragged(x,y)  If the uses didn't click in the scroll element the setNewScrollPosition method id called.
            else
               setNewScrollPositionClicked(x,y)

      • paint

        protected void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw the scrollbar. If the scrollbar is disabled the "Disabled" color is used.
        Overrides:
        paint in class Component
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object on which to paint.
